channel.title: Comments on: Don’t put a return statement in a stored procedure inside a transaction
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: jamiet
item.dc:creator: jamiet
item.description: I abhor the use of return codes for stored procs, don't see the value of them whatsoever and I never use them.
item.content:encoded: I abhor the use of return codes for stored procs, don’t see the value of them whatsoever and I never use them.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.description: Agreed, I do the same, I usually return the ERROR_MESSAGE() via an output parameter to the caller as well
item.content:encoded: Agreed, I do the same, I usually return the ERROR_MESSAGE() via an output parameter to the caller as well

item.title: By: Adrian Hills
item.dc:creator: Adrian Hills
item.content:encoded:
I personally always use OUTPUT parameters – greater flexibility (not tied to just returning INTEGER datatype).

Also, for result codes, I often prefer a VARCHAR OUTPUT parameter instead of an INTEGER RETURN value – the coded VARCHAR can be semi-descriptive and more immediately intuitive than a random number.
